Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to recommend this hotel because it's small (20 rooms) and recommendations will just encourage more bookings so that next time we may not get in! Wonderful location right on the Bosphorus. Asian side which means using the hotel's free shuttle launch to get across to the city each day. Apart from the grumpy boat pilot (more amusing than irritating) this 20 minute each way ride was the highlight. The Bosphorus is a fascinating stretch of water full of boats from tiny to gigantic. You could spend all day on the hotel terrace watching them go by. If the weather's OK you can eat outside on said terrace. Menu limited but food delicious. We had 2 level 'loft room' (so called because you go upstairs to the bedroom/bathroom) opening out onto garden terrace. Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Real relaxing on the water”
Reviews.Author: GVtravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel makes for an experience by itself - it gives an Instabul visit a different flavor. The reason is that all rooms are facing the Bosporus, from very close - you will want to stay in the room and watch the boats pass by. Overall the room and common areas are modern and well designed. Location is a big issue however, since it is on the anatolia side, and most of business/tourist attractions are on the european side, and taking the bridge is a major time burden. THe hotel offers for free a boat ride, which is convenient for the morning or afternoon, but likely not in the evening - check before you book. This inconvenience is significant, but overall a small price to pay for the good feel of this place, owed to the view and design.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Mohammed A
Reviews.Content: I always stay in a big five start hotels whenever I travel but Sumohan is different I really felt the warmth, I felt like if I was at my own home I mean first the views from the rooms were extremely thrilling to the eyes. I stayed in two different bedrooms first the loft suite which was very unique in the design which also has a small Turkish bath in it which was unbelievable and views were very nice and the second bedrooms which was deluxe bedroom which also has excellent views as well and bedroom was very nice itself. The staff are very helpful, friendly and welcoming indeed and especially at the reception and that is what made my stay more enjoyable and relaxing despite I was in a business trip I really felt I was like special guest to them while I think they do the same to other gusts. I would differently go back whenever I go to Istanbul which this hotel became my home now. Mohammed Alzubairi, Yemen

Reviews.Title: “I would end an Istanbul stay here”
Reviews.Author: AyeAre
Reviews.Content: Everything has been said about how amazing this place is really, can't add much more. The location is fantastic for relaxation and lounging by the Bosphorus. The breakfast is great if a little overwhelming! If your trip to Istanbul is for sight seeing in the city centre, I would say stay somewhere cheaper and more central for your first few days, then end the holiday with a couple of days' relaxation at Sumahan.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: NancySN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a second honeymoon at the Sumahan. We are world travelers, global citizens. As I write, we have traveled to over 60 countries for work and travel. Our week at the Sumahan was one of the most delightful times we have ever experienced. Our room was relaxing and wonderful. The view spectacular. The restaurant at the Sumahan provided excellent breakfasts and romantic dinners. The only down side to this incredible hotel is that we had to check out after a week that felt like a dream. We will return. I hope many times. I recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but not kind”
Reviews.Author: Denizasiri
Reviews.Content: We have been to Sumahan once just after our wedding for honeymoon. Arrived at the hotel around midnight wearing our wedding dresses, and went to our room directly. Rooms & the hotel was really nice, clean. Also the view was one of the best in the world. On the other hand they knew that we were there for our honeymoon, but they didn't put anything extra although we paid a lot for the room; at least flower or a bottle of wine etc. I know many hotels provide nice complimentary things for new couples. So very disappointed because I thought it was a very romantic hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing boutique hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: ned87
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many boutique hotels round the world, but Sumahan exceeds all the other ones by miles. This hotel is a very special place on the Bosphorous with amazing views. I have since stayed here many times, the service is outstanding and the staff are very helpful and they go out of their way to satisfy you, i.e call reception to ask them to go and purchase cigarettes and bring to the room, buy a hairdryer and bring to room. very helpful. There is also a fab fish restaurant in the hotel, you must try if you are staying there. The room service is amazing regardless what time in the day or night, and house keeping staff are truly amazing, they leave the room spotless every single day without any tips, but its nice to leave them something as they work very hard. Overall Sumahan is precious gem hidden away. Truly 5 star hotel along with 5 star service. Definitively recommend this place if you are staying in Istanbul and you want to stay away from the tacky hotels of taksim.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: CaptainD66
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this property, a stunning location with great views, combined with helpful friendly staff who would literally go out of their way to assist in making my stay a pleasant one! I would not hesitate to go back to this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “One of the best boutique hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: CraigNM
Reviews.Content: Right on the Bosphorous with remarkable views from every room this place is an masterpiece of architecture and design. Recently renovated from an old industrial building, the hotel has wonderfully comfortable rooms (with fireplaces), spa, outstanding restuarant, and lovely library. The hotel's cute commuter boat runs guests across the water to center Istanbul, avoiding all the impossible road traffic, a real boon at rush hours and an especially nice way to spend 30 minutes watching the constantly changing port and strait. Perfect both for business and tourism. And the rates are remarkably reasonable for all that you get!

Reviews.Title: “Sumahan on the Water, Fun and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JHHinTurkey
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Sumahan. Our room overlooked the Bosporus with a view of the bridge and light show at night and the endless parade of boats. The staff were kind and the owners delightful! The restaurant was great - don't miss the bulgur salad with pomegranate sauce.

Reviews.Title: “Great being on the water”
Reviews.Author: walkabout101
Reviews.Content: Hotel isn't super fancy inside or out, but I liked the atmosphere. I didn't find much to do on the Asian side other than be a foodie. I liked the shuttle boat, but operated by "Captain Crabby", he certainly wasn't there for his hospitality. Had a suite with a great view of the Bosphorus bridge, with it's nightly light show. The glassed in bathroom isn't for the modest. From certain areas in the room, you can see reflections of whoever is in there, even on the toilet. Shower stall leaked water onto the floor. Breakfast was nice, and room service good. The room had a wood fireplace, and each night, we asked them to light us a fire. That was a nice touch. Had dinner at their restaurant, that was good too. Had good sleeps, bed and pillows were comfy, and room was quiet. Tried the Hamam (Turkish bath) in their spa, was a very different experience, quite pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off Extrodinaire and Arrogant Management”
Reviews.Author: elterrill
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week in the top suite and spent well over A$6000(US$7000). Firstly, on a positive note, the breakfast staff in the restaurant were great and accommodating to everything, absolutely lovely. The loveliness stopped there. We experienced noise from both the kitchen and the public restaurant right next to our room. We were given incorrect directions to entertainment that we had booked and therefore missed it. Maids would not remove any rubbish that came from outside of the hotel. In exasperaton, we wrote a list of complaints and presented it to management. They rudely dismissed out concerns and told us that they were invalid. Gohkan was particularly obnoxious. Hotel boat arrangements were muddled and the hotel is unknown to local taxis if you use public transport. We were misled about acceptable currencies and prices were quoted inconsistently in different currencies (euros and liras) although they only accept liras. This so called five star hotel treats their guests with one star consideration, if that. We asked to be put in touch with the owners but they refused. Avoid Sumahan on the water.

Reviews.Title: “Very special treat”
Reviews.Author: Karaliayfer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the 18th of October 11 for a birthday treat and anniversary celebration. I come across the hotel by luck because I was trying to book a nice place in Istanbul and Sumahan come up; I read the reviews and decided to book it. It was a wonderful experience could not be a better choice. It is a special place as I prefer to stay in boutique type of places rather than big hotel chains therefore it was the perfect choice. The view is amazing all rooms have sea view I believe, we stayed in Vanikoy, the rooms have names rather than numbers which is a nice touch. The room is large and best views of the Bosphorous you can get; the bathroom has a glass window which allows you to look out to the Boshphours good thinking! There is a real fire place in the room and the weather was perfect for the fire place we requested to be lit up and they did it straight away. The staff is very helpful and pleasant and all communicate in English. The hotel provides a complimentary ferrry service across to Kabatas and Kurucesme at set times that you are advised to book. Kabatas would be the point where you can take tram into the heart of the old city therefore the location of Sumahan should not deter you to book this hotel otherwise you would miss out the experience. Sumahan also has a Hamam which is booked specially for you for the time no others can use it which is excellent; the buble massage is fabulous try it. When we finished in the hamam our snacks and drinks were ready for us in the rest area where you can lie down and have some drink and snack before you can retire to your room it was great. We had dinner in the hotel which was good we both had stake the sauce was slightly sweet to my taste which could have been less. They serve a fantastic breakfast all cereal; fruit,yogurth, pastries and proper Turkish breakfast with cheese olives and eggs cook to your preference really good breakfast I have not had for a long time anywhere else. We will definetly go back to Sumahan maybe in the summer the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and calm in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dfgibbs
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from four nights at Sumahan on the Water. Agree with most of the reviews on Trip Advisor; the hotel is beautiful, luxurious, the staff are friendly and helpful etc. We had a loft room which was great and very spacious. Loved sitting outside our room, just by the river. We spent most of our time visiting the tourist sights which meant taking the hotel ferry most mornings at 9:00am, which was a lovely way to start the day. We then took trams or buses to the sights, before returning to the hotel around 6:00pm by public ferry and bus. The Istanbul Pass is great. We got ours from reception and topped it up twice at the machines which are everywhere. We did need some help to top up the first time but a friendly local helped us when we were looking confused! We sometimes took the hotel ferry again to go out in the evening, sometimes the public ferry. Note the timetable to Cengelkoy (only three minutes walk from the hotel) only runs during â€™rush hourâ€™. We used this one morning when we wanted to get into town early. Yes, the ferries finish before midnight, but we never had a problem getting a taxi, which are cheap by UK standards.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but location can be a problem”
Reviews.Author: HatSisters
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great and staff were pleasant. Right on the river and great views of the European side. And if there is a problem it is that â€“ the location. Traffic is Istanbul is not great and while cabs are cheap and plentiful, you will need to leave early to get to that restaurant booking on the European side and it is a long way back to the hotel after a evening out. The hotelâ€™s boat is great and easy on and off, water taxiâ€™s are expensive and bit more challenging. Shame the hotel boat doesnâ€™t run more frequently or later. Note if you expect to use the hotel boat back from the European side make sure you have booked/confirmed it. The public ferry is fun, but the last back is at 23.30hrs. Best tip: Get an Istanbul card â€“ itâ€™s like the oyster card in London- and you can use it on boat, tram, bus or metro.

Reviews.Title: “A Luxurious Alternative on the Asian Side”
Reviews.Author: MarcDavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sumahan on our return to Istanbul, at the end of our trip before heading home. This turned out to be perfect; things are quieter on the Asian side, but that was ok for us as we had already seen all of the sights in the old town and on the European side in our first go-round. The hotel is smack on the shores of the Bosphorus and all of the serene rooms have amazing views of the water and the bridge (and fireplaces if its cold enough, we were there in warm weather). The staff is very professional, discrete and helpful. The hotel has its own restaurant with a patio right on the water, a full-service spa/hammam, and to cap it off they also have a private boat (small!) that will take you across to the European side (there is also a regularly scheduled commuter ferry that lets off just down the block and which goes to the old city). All of that said, the hotel is on the expensive side and not the most convenient to the bulk of the tourist sites. Still, if its a quiet, luxurious waterside getaway you're looking for, and you don't mind hopping a boat to get to the action, this is certainly a lovely choice.

Reviews.Title: “Get spoiled at 5-meters away from the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: geto_dam
Reviews.Content: With all the special qualities of the Asian Istanbul, this hotel shares a wonderful atmosphere with guests. Loft rooms are excellent in comfort and view to the Bosphorus, seagulls come across the windows to make you feel you're floating in a boat. Although the staff were doing their best, but they could not meet all the requirements of the fine service you would expect from such a place, in terms of communication (language) and late room service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views - though a little bit of a trek”
Reviews.Author: detang
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been restored very well. Located on the Bosphorous, you get a truly unique view of Turkey. Because we spent our initial 3 days in the city, we wanted to have another experience of staying by the Bosphorous. As we had already visited most of the sites in the old city whilst we stayed there, we used the Sumahan to venture into the other areas of Istanbul. There's a free of charge private ferry which takes you to the other side. Upon arriving on the other side, the city trams are very convenient. Logistics out of the way, the in room breakfast was fantastic. Being able to eat breakfast in your room, overlooking the ships travelling to and thru on the Bosphorous is truly memorable. Rooms are well appointed and an added bonus was having a Turkish Haman in house. Managed to have a massage - which was mediocre but then I am comparing techniques and training to Asia. Overall, a wonderful stay and indeed unique.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Hospitality at its Best”
Reviews.Author: JeffersonLondon
Reviews.Content: Each time I stay here the experience only gets better. The location might take a little getting used to if you have never been to Istanbul before, but the views are worth it, and once you know how to navigate the Bosphorus being on the Asian shore is no problem. Just make a few plans and get used to jumping on and off ferry boats and into taxis - it all becomes part of the romance of being in Istanbul. It's the staff though that make staying here so good. They really do work hard to make everything run smoothly from the moment you arrive - when a refreshing drink is delivered whilst you relax and unwind in the beautiful library that overlooks the Bosphorous. Even the least expensive room is perfectly equipped, and comes complete with a luxurious marble bathroom. If you want the full Turkish experience then there is a spa with Hamam in the basement. I can recommend the swedish massage - perfect way to relax at the end of a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, views and service - Sumahan has it all”
Reviews.Author: PiscoBristol
Reviews.Content: Everything about Sumahan is fantastic. Before we booked we were concerned that, being on the Asian side, we would be a bit out of the way - we needn't have worried as the location was perfect. It is a 35 to 45 (depending on traffic) taxi ride from Ataturk Airport. Then, once you are at Sumahan, there are plenty of ways to get over to the sights at Sultanahmet and the Beyoglu/Taksim Square areas. The Hotel has its own private launch which leaves twice in the morning, at lunch and in the evening, the journey over takes about 25 minutes and drops you at Kabatas where you can pick up a metro to take you directly to Sultanahmet, a road taxi or the funicular up to Taksim Square depending on where you want to go. On the occasions we used it, we had it to ourselves. You can also get a water taxi which will pick you up from the hotel, more expensive but quicker and more direct if you want to go anywhere other than Kabatas. The other option, apart from a road taxi, is one of the ferries that go from Cengelkoy (the ferry station is 5 minutes slow walk from the hotel) to Emminou- they are extremely cheap. Of course, the final option is a road taxi, which are extremely cheap and will get you to central Istanbul very quickly. Apart from the amazing location on the Bosphorus, the terrace overlooking the river where you can lounge in the sun, the great spa with hammam, the stunning views, and the immaculate rooms, the thing that makes Sumahan stand out is the staff, all are friendly, welcoming and eager to help. In particular, Gohan GÃ¶k was outstanding: he helped us with our travel arrangements, sorted us out with a transport card to use on buses, metros, trams and funiculars, booked some wonderful restaurants for us in Cengelkoy and on the European side and generally helped make our trip a memorable one. Finally, don't forget to explore Cengelkoy, where the hotel is located. It is a small fishing village, with some lovely bakeries, and other small shops and restaurants. We had a very pleasant day, after a morning enjoying the Hammam and spa treatments, we strolled into the village and got stocked up on the lovely pastries, bread, cakes, fruit and olive oil from the local shops - the perfect end to our stay and a real contrast to the European side where we spent the majority of our time.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved our time here. A unique, truly memorable boutique.”
Reviews.Author: MCAZ2011
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in July 2011 for 6 days at the end of a 20 day Turkey trip. It was perfect for us. We consider this one of the handful of hotels that are truly memorable and unique. We are now at home in Phoenix, experiencing Istanbul and Sumahan withdrawals! A few thoughts: We stayed on the European side for a few days early in our trip to have ready access to the main sites, and this was a good decision for us. After Cappadocia, Sirence, and Ephesus, the more relaxed Asian side was exactly what we wanted. We also felt we came to understand the "real" Istanbul from exploring the villages adjacent to the Sumahan. The service is exceptional. Seek out Nural, who is genuine and extremely helpful. We own hotels in the Western US, and I have been telling Nural stories to our managers as examples of the right way to treat guests. The Sumahan staff know a great deal about the local village in particular and Istanbul in general. And they are delighted to help you figure out the best restaurants, experiences, etc. I have seen complaints below about privacy issues (chairs used, etc.). Those are really expectations issues. Istanbul is a large, congested city, so don't expect an expansive resort. The Sumahan is a 20-room boutique hotel with incredible Bosphorus views and impeccable service. It is a real gem of a tiny hotel. The space and privacy are amazing in the context of the teeming, dense city surrounding you, but the site is compact, so have your expectations in line. The boat service to the European side is convenient, but limited, so make sure to reserve seats when you know you are going. Coming back, the boat does not run at night, but ferries are inexpensive and relatively convenient. From the great selection of small pamplets at the front desk, we discovered water taxis, which you should definitely consider. For 75 TL from Kabatas (about $40), you can take a party of 2-10 right back to the hotel, 24 hours a day, and fast. To catch our plane home, we even took a water taxi to Eminonu (100TL), and caught a taxi there. It avoided the bridge traffic, shortened our trip, and we got to say goodbye to Istanbul by water, the best way. Water taxi res number is, I believe, local 444-4498, or front desk wil arrange.

Reviews.Title: “We simply loved it .....”
Reviews.Author: VDTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sumahan for 5 nights, were a group of eight. We simply loved the hotel style, the friendliness and professionalism of the staff (Cher Nural mille merci pour tout !!), the location on the peaceful Asian part of beautiful Istanbul. Breakfast. afternoon drinks or dinner at the Sumahan were a delight and the trip through the Bosporus on the Hotel's Navette a great experience especially after a buzzy day in the city. The rooms were spacious and in perfect condition, the reception staff had good restaurant ideas and was helpful in all other matters ( We had to take our daughter to the hospital, the hotel staff organised this is a second). We will certainly return. The only thing missing at Sumahan is a long lap pool ....

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable business trip, characterful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clarabellestar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in July 2011, on business. Arriving early, and jet lagged, the night porter did his best to accommodate me, and eventually got me into a comfortable room around 10 am. Before then, I relaxed by the Bosphorous in the lovely hotel restaurant, which is beautifully located and very peaceful. Watching the cargo boats chug up towards the Black Sea, and the racing yachts zoom out towards the Sea of Marmara is wonderful. My room is comfortable but fairly basic. It's got everything I need, is comfortably decorated and reasonably stylish. Not as thoughtfully done or as unique as other "boutique" properties, but certainly nothing to complain about. The wifi is reliable and quick, which, given this trip is mainly about business, is fine. The facilities of the hotel are quite basic. There is a cute spa, with a nice hamman and massage treatments. I enjoyed both, but was somewhat surprised to have a male therapist for both - I didn't particularly mind, but I would have expected to have a choice. The gym is very small and boxy, I got as far as the door, took one look and decided I'd prefer to do some yoga in my room instead. Many other reviewers have mentioned the staff - they're not super smiley, but when I've needed anything they've been very helpful. The staff on front desk speak great English, in other parts of the hotel including the restaurant, less so. My Turkish is non-existent, so there's been the occasional small problem. It is miles away from the main tourist sites - not a problem for me this trip, but if you're not comfortable with using public transport then I can imagine it would get frustrating quite quickly. However, on the plus side, the location on the water is beautiful, and if you prefer seeing a more authentic, less touristy side to Istanbul, this could be the right place for you.

Reviews.Title: “We adored it and will return. Would not go anywhere else in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Fusun777
Reviews.Content: My American husband and Chilean sister and her husband stayed at the Sumahan from the 22nd of June till the 1st of July. Being a Turk I regularyly go to Istanbul, a magical city. Being the daughter of a diplomat and the wife of a buisnessman I have travelled the world and stayed at many 5 star hotels. I have rarely, if ever, found a Boutique Hotel which has ALL the requisities of a discriminating guest: beautiful rooms with incredible views of the Bosphorus., From the room you feel as if you are on a ship. A fabulous Spa with a private Turkish bath and an amazing masseuse by the name of Asuman. An incredible team of desk managers ready to fulfill all your needs and anwer all your questions. Both the Sales Manager Mr. Gokhan Gok and the Duty Manager Mr. Nural Inciler and Ms. Berna Tikir were outstanding. The food on the lovely terrace facing the European side was good and the service was excellent. One felt at home. A daily excellent laundry service and an amazing library on Turkish History and authors adds to the list of excellence. You don't need to take any books, you can spend a month there and not have the time to read it all! From all four of us this Boutique Hotel gets a 5 Stars. It tops the Four Seasons and the Kapinsky by far. Fusun Dulger Charles Denville New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Our perfect home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: doc6253
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days and returned for an addition 5 days of pure bliss. We liked the small size, fabulous view, helpful and friendly staff. They catered to our every wish. The food was superb we ate 3 wonderful dinners while watching the sunset. The health club surpassed my stringent requirements. We plan on returning. Probably best suited for a longer stay since traffic across the bridge can impact access to the European side, the free boat shuttle helped otherwise you must allow an our or more if you start early or coming back after 4. The lofts gave my family a spacious accomodation and again the staff was only surpassed by the view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place!”
Reviews.Author: EHirschhorn
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to this marvelous hotel, which was once a distillery. In addition to being in Istanbul, which is an utterly fascinating city, it's sufficiently small and out of the way to be great for just chilling out. It's beautifully decorated, with floor-to-ceiling windows looking out on the Bosphorus, which is only a few feet away. Eager and attentive staff whose English is excellent. The hotel owns a launch that plies the strait between the hotel and downtown several times a day; there's also a pubic ferry terminal about a five-minute walk away from which there are regular ferries to the Galata Bridge terminal. The restaurant is excellent, too, as is the one (same ownership, I believe) next door. The Sumahan is an excellent value if you want a top-flight place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel, one of the finest...”
Reviews.Author: Simon_Mizrahi
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively across the world and the Sumahan is, beyond the shadow of a doubt, one of the finest hotels I have ever stayed in. The trip to Istanbul was a surprise for my wife, to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. We were not disappointed. The hotel is superb, the design and taste are impeccable, the view on the Bosphorus absolutely breathtaking and the hotel staff offer some of the best examples of Turkish hospitality. On arriving at the hotel, Nural, the hotel manager, made sure that candles had been placed in the room and that a bottle of wine was waiting for us! We look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable relaxing small hotel with stunning views...”
Reviews.Author: gene
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sumahan for just two nights at the end of our trip. We had previously stayed in Sultanhamet so wanted a different perspective from the Asian side. The location is really perfect...great views of the Bosphorus and just steps from the very charming Cengelkoy. We booked one of the loft suites and the room was beautiful. The only problem is as the previous reviewer commented ,the room is far from private.Actually you open your door to a public area and the ones on the end are near restaurants. Sometimes we found our chairs gone and most of the time our neighbors were out (three young people) and talking loudly on their cell phones. I actually think other room types which are less expensive would offer more privacy. Indeed the room description does not indicate that the garden area is "private" so not much to complain about. Were I to return I would opt for another room type and not pay a premium for the direct access. Our welcome was very nice and in general the hotel staff aims to please. Breakfast was very nice and you could order some eggs etc. which were included. Lovely breakfast room and outside terrace. We did not eat in the Kordon Restaurant because I had read about the prices and asked about a less expensive option...they booked Iskele just down the block and it was fantastic...and just as much if not more atmosphere. For our last night they booked Borsa which has a wonderful view but nothing better than you could find at the hotel and we found it business like and rather stuffy...food was good. The private boat shuttle was efficient and they can provide you with an Akbil to be used on the tram which leaves right from where the boat takes you. Fun experience. Because we had done our major sightseeing we only used it once. Stolling around Cengelkoy early morning or evening was really a treat with lots of local color and few if any tourists around. That was great. We wanted a transfer to return to the airport (we had our own to arrive) and hotel seemed only interested in two options local taxi (about 40 Euro) or VIP Limo quoted at 125 Euro. I asked a few times as I was not excited about that ride in a taxi (never know what you will get) and could not justify 125 Euro to go to airport. I did my own research and booked one of the many transfer companies who picked us up promptly in a very nice van and cost was 40 Euro. It seems that option could have been offered given my requests. I understand Sumahan is five star but most hotels would offer all options. I would recommend this hotel for your stay in Istanbul if you are looking for a quiet location and don't mind the transit to the major tourist sights. Excellent for return visit to Istanbul. We enjoyed our stay at the Sumahan despite the few negative comments.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a gem. The appearance and the service was as promised. You can definitely enjoy the Bosphorus.”
Reviews.Author: DonutDollie
Reviews.Content: Wonderful views. Great windows that open so you can truly enjoy the experience of being right on the Bosphorus Strait. Very helpful desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Mark_in_Sydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sumahan for the last 3 days of our stay in Istanbul, to have a few days on the quieter Asian side of Istanbul. ("Quieter" is relative in Istanbul.) They have their own small boat (classic, stylish launch) that has a scheduled service between the hotel & key points on the European side (their web site has its schedule). We had a Junior Terrace Suite - top floor single level, the "Beykoz" room. It is beautifully designed and modern, & our favourite activity was watching the boats & ships on the Bosphorus and the lights change on the first bridge, & the Euro side. The hotel is right on the water. The king bed was very comfortable. Location - this can be a plus or minus depending what you want. We liked being "away" from the busier side. There's only a few sights & you need to use taxis, but the Euro side is available through the hotel's boat or regular city ferries from a wharf 5 minutes walk away. There's a small town a few minutes' walk away. Ensure you get their map, & their address on their card as the hotel is not obvious to most taxis from the street. The location itself is a well-to-do area, though the small town nearby is more typical Istanbul. Service - was impeccable, helpful & friendly. The owner/architect came out to introduce herself given we'd come from Australia. Food - they have a small in-house restaurant with quality & OK-priced local & international meals. Wine is pricey but the local wine choice is better than most restaurants. There's several high standard restaurants close by (used by wealthy locals, judging by the number of Porches!). Sights - not as much as the Euro side, but head south, & also get a cruise up the Bosphorus towards the Black Sea. Facilities - there's a small gym, and a small hammam. No pool. This is a boutique hotel not a generic faceless chain, though they do get CNN if you can't escape propaganda. Watch the Bosphorus, not TV! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, the great views and the timeliness of all boat shuttles. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tisidor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sumahan on the Water for four nights in April and it was a great choice. My hesitation was in staying on the Asian side of Istanbul, but the shuttle boat works magnificently. Every room at the hotel has great views of the Bosphorus river and the European side of Istanbul. The key is the shuttle boat, which provides timely 20 minute rides across the river to the main tram station. From there, all the major spots in Istanbul are easily within reach. Once we arranged for the shuttle to pick us up at an alternate spot across the river, and the boat appeared at the dock right on schedule. I was very impressed. The staff was very helpful in mapping out alternate ways back to the hotel via other shuttles and taxis if out of hours, and were extremely attentive. Our room had a sitting room and a fireplace which provided the perfect atmosphere after dealing with the hustle and bustle of Istanbul. If you don't mind the 20 minute boat ride, you'll love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A completely delightful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Peponi
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Istanbul where we stayed at this really lovely all round wonderful little boutique hotel right on the Bosphorus. The hotel itself is supremely comfortable, our room and bathroom were very well fitted out and presented, with a view across the twinkling Bosphorus to die for. The boats and ships and frolicking dolphins were a wonderful sight to wake up to and visible even while sitting in the bath! The srtaff were brilliant, discreet, helpful and nothing was too much trouble. We felt so very well looked after! And the food in the restaurant was simply delicious. We were also given some excellent recommendations for other restaurants and those that we had tried prebooking from the UK but which were apparently already fully booked magically had tables available after a call from Sumahan! Nothing was impossible, everything was smoothly provided and always with a smile and frequently there were thoughtful little extras. We found the short commute from Sumahan on the Asian shore to the sights and restaurants on the European shore very easy and convenient, whether by hotel launch or by public ferries from the termini nearby, and this added even more enjoyment to the whole experience. Sumahan truly is a beautiful little jewel and I cannot recommend it more highly!

Reviews.Title: “terrific and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Barbara_Germany17
Reviews.Content: we loved it there!!! The rooms with fireplaces are awesome. since it rained all day we especially enjoyed the fireplace. Special thanks to Nural the duty manager. He was charming and competent and took care of everything. The Hotel has a nice hammam where you can have a typical turkish bath. The location is no problem as there is a hotel ferry and the next public ferry station is not far away. Crossing the Bosporus to get into the hustling old town is part of the experience. Definitely coming back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Too short a stay”
Reviews.Author: Liliasolaregunt
Reviews.Content: We reached Sumahan after a long taxi ride from congested Istanbul, to find a delightful and peaceful boutique hotel located on the Asian side of the Bosphorus. All very nicely appointed rooms have views on the water, with the Bosphorus bridge and Istanbul in the background. We spent three days there and fully enjoyed the local village scene and the complimentary sea shuttle private service from the hotel to Istanbul. Definitely a place to remember and recommend. A special thanks to Nural, the Duty Manager, who guided us in perfect French around the hotel and made us immediately feel welcomed. Thanks to have assisted us throughout our stay, in particular with hints on local restaurants that we fully enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tyrkiet2011
Reviews.Content: Super great hotel in a lovely location. Suitable for families. We will come back next time we go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “First class service - wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: JORO7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six days and were still gazing at the views along the Bosphorus at the end of our stay. Some distance from the old city and main tourist sites but the fact that you travel to the city via the hotel's own small boat makes the journey itself part of the experience - fantastic views of palaces along the water's edge. Being on the Asian side adds to journey from Ataturk airport - ideal if you can time your arrival to take advantage of the hotel's boat timetable - will reduce journey time and its the best way to approach the hotel. The staff were excellent - very friendly and helpful. They made for an extremely enjoyable stay. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it would be amazing - but it was better than that...”
Reviews.Author: thecallipygousone
Reviews.Content: A brilliant renovation of the old family distillery.. the terrace over the Bosphorus is ridiculously exciting.. and the hotel restaurant provided us with a perfect late lunch. It is true - the effortlessly elegant and wonderfully-coiffured manager Nural can and did organise anything we needed - he would probably have let me beat him at backgammon if I had asked.. The launch across to Europe is a wonderful treat - and what a fabulous way to arrive.. We ate at the fish restaurant next to sumahan the afternoon we left - three lazy hours feeling like Suleiman the Magnificent

Reviews.Title: “The oasis of tranquility in an otherwise bustling city”
Reviews.Author: pegs-EU
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have chosen a better hotel if we'd tried. Nural's welcome and continuous service throughout our 4 day stay was first class, as was the service provided by all the hotel staff (including restaurant menu, wine selection, hamam and massage centre, library with books on Turkey in many languages, etc.). The reception staff were a mine of information on Istanbul, places to visit, how best to get there. A nearby local restaurant was also recommended serving typical Istanbul dishes amongst other delicacies. The hotel itself has the best views of the Bosphorus, and from all of its rooms, which are spacious and with a careful attention to detail (open fire, views of the Bosphorus even from the shower, fruit on a platter to name but some). The location is perfect for those that love the quiet and tranquility while at the same time being only a short boat ride from the bustling European side. The hotel also provides its own taxi boat for its guests between the Hotel (on the Asian side) and the European side. A totally unexpected pleasurable experience to be repeated.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Respite in an Incredible City of Magic and Mood”
Reviews.Author: lscohen
Reviews.Content: My partner and I came to Istanbul and Cappodokya for the first time in October, ending our sojourn at Sumahan for 3 nights. We stayed closer to the Old City for the first part of our trip, left for Central Turkey in the middle, and capped off a wonderful adventure, by staying here, on the Asia side, between the two great bridges spanning the Bosphorous. When here, it rained for the better part of the 3 days; but we encountered no difficulties making our way into the Old City yet again(by ferry) or around fascinating spots in the vicinity. Our room, a 2-story loft was modern, and cozy with spectacular views of the water, and the multi-colored lightshow that decorated the bridge within view. The fireplace was a welcome and supremely romantic addition: maintained and supplied by the hotel staff within seconds of any request or call. My only criticism of our room, was that the furniture seemed a little worn. The most exceptional aspect(besides this beautiful location and hotel): the staff. The staff at Sumahan was ever present to attend to requests and offer assistance in any way they could. We most appreciated the evening manager, Nural, who was consistently amazing in offering us direction and help. Without a doubt, Nural's recommendations were spot-on. He sent us off for our 3 nights, to the 3 most delightful meals of our entire stay in Istanbul. To top it off: when my partner left her treasured ipod in Cappodokya, Nural and the staff of Sumahan, coordinated the arrangements for shipping it to us there. Unfortunately it did not arrive in time before our departure, but no worries! Nural made arrangements to have it brought back to us by another visitor who was returning to the vicinity of our home in California. He called us several times to follow-up and be certain we had received the ipod. this is the definition of caring management! I hope and have every intention to return to this beautiful place, and hope to land once again on the shores of Sumahan.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: vogt
Reviews.Content: We are a family of two adults and two teenagers. All of us were delighted to stay at the Sumahan and felt at home immediately. The trips with the boat from the hotel to downtown Istanbul were marvellous and in the evenings we were happy to come "home" with "our" boat to this peaceful and wonderful place. The duty managers are extremly friendly and helpful, especially Mr. Nural Inciler who also speaks French as if he was a Frenchman. Breakfast is great and the rooms (we had a family room) big, comfortable, well furnished and cosy. Very evening we had a fire in the fire-place. We all agreed that we would stay again at the Sumahan the next time we go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Istanbul stay on the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: lorilander
Reviews.Content: What a magical wonderful place. We had five days to spend exploring Istanbul in the heat of August. After a great deal of research, we set aside recommendations of lovely hotels in Sultanahmet and chose Sumahan on the Water. It is beautiful small hotel designed by its owner/architects to renovate a family owned raki distillery. What a magical wonderful place. We had five days to spend exploring Istanbul in the heat of August. There were 6 of us. Myself and my husband and two of our children (15 and 22) and two friends (in their 30s). After a great deal of research, we set aside recommendations of lovely hotels in Sultanahmet and chose Sumahan on the Water. What a perfect choice. We arrived after hours of flying across the Atlantic and Europe and were greeted with smiles and glasses of fragrant and delicious lemonade enhanced with fresh sage leaves. The rooms are coolly elegant and comfortable. The beds and linens supremely comfortable. The interior bathrooms have windows with views of the Bosphorus. Every afternoon a small plate of fresh fruit was waiting for us in the room. In August, Istanbul was beautiful and very hot. Being able to return to Sumahan each afternoon by a beautiful boat trip and then sit and relax outside on the banks of the Bosphorus enjoying the breeze was heaven. Other days, we relaxed in the lovely sitting room and library overlooking the Bosphorus with a public computer. The library is filled with hundreds of books on Istanbul and Turkey. And of course a backgammon set. The restaurant was lovely. Breakfast (included in the price of the room) started with a plate of fresh cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, cheese and cold cuts. Then a basket of fresh rolls. And then eggs prepared as you wished . In the late afternoon, we ordered delicious mezes as we sat in comfortable chairs next to the Bosphorus watching the boats go by and the sun setting behind the hills on the European side. For dinner, all of the Turkish specialties were absolutely delicious (we did not try the Western dishes). One dessert had us asking for a recipe - a pumpkin in syrup with vanilla ice cream was amazing. One night we walked into Cengelkoy and ate at a small local fish restaurant, another night we took a short taxi ride further up the coast to a well recommended and delicious restaurant (Suna's Place). Every guide book tells you that you must take a Bosphorus cruise. We were lucky enough to be taking it daily. The hotel has its own wonderful boat that makes several trips daily between the hotel and the European shore, leaving you right next to the tram. Before arriving, I worried about whether it would be difficult to get back and forth to the hotel if we missed the hotel boat's scheduled trips. I worried needlessly. If you want to travel at another time, the hotel staff can make arrangements or give you information about the local public ferry which docks a 5 minute walk from the hotel (or other ferries that cross the Bosphorus every 15 minutes a cheap taxi ride away.) Beyond the physical loveliness of Sumahan, what makes it even more magical is the staff. Everyone was friendly, helpful and solicitous. But Nural Inciler, a manager, went beyond. He welcomed us as treasured guests, greeting us each afternoon, genuinely curious about what we had seen, where we had explored, offering suggestions and ideas. We loved our trip to Istanbul. Our stay at Sumahan made it magic.

Reviews.Title: “"Amazing Bosporus sun sets in a very friendly and stylish boutique hotel"”
Reviews.Author: abd_10
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel in one of the best locations on the Bosporus. Relaxed atmoshphere, tastey food, gorgeous rooms with views of the Bosporus from your bed! Can only recommend it to anybody with style and class who does not look for a show off hotel!

Reviews.Title: “So Beautiful we had to get married there!”
Reviews.Author: AlexClow
Reviews.Content: The setting at the Sumahan is nothing short of magical. You could practically dangle your feet from your hotel room into the Bosphorous it is so near. The building which is a renovation of an old distillery has been immaculately conceived by its architect owners. The design and decor are faultless throughout the communal areas and rooms. My wife and I chose to have a humanist wedding ceremony at the Sumahan in August 2010 and it was absolutely perfect. We had guests from all over the world, al of whom where blown away by the whole affair; the building, the rooms, the view and the service. There is also an excellent fish restaurant (Kordon) right next door which is where we chose to have the wedding dinner. The location really suits us as it is very tranquil and the hectic crowds of Sultanahmet feel a thousand miles away. You can however get across to the European side very conveniently using the complimentary boat shuttle which is not only practical but also an experience in itself. The service is fantastic with a very warm welcome from the moment you arrive. Barely had our suitcases touched the floor on arrival, before glasses of fresh lemonade were offered to us and our luggage was whisked away to our rooms. We used both a standard (deluxe) room and an Executive Suite - both were excellent and the suite really does take your breathe away when you first enter. We wouldn't change much with this hotel; only possible criticism we could have is the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms and the rather lacklustre mini-bar (bottled water only albeit complimentary). However these are tiny details and would certainly not stop us from returning (which we have every intention of doing!). An unforgettable place for an unforgettable day - thank you Sumahan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully designed alternative destination for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Gorgeous10
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights here in August 2010 and really liked the place. If you're happy to be away from the tourist hub of Sultanahmet, this is a chic, contemporary "designer" hotel, right on the water, as the name suggests. Lovely interiors, excellent reception staff, exudes quality everywhere. Food is nothing special, but there's lots of choice nearby. The best thing is the location, as long as you're happy to take the hotel's shuttle launch across the Bosphorus to the "European" side, then continue your journey by tram or taxi. We were more than happy - the boat trip is all part of the adventure and we had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect get away for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: caiwoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Sumahan Hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and the boat that shuttled us back and forth between the Asian and European side of Istanbul was not only extremely convenient, but the ride was gorgeous. We hope to visit again someday soon.

Reviews.Title: “An Asian-side delight by the water”
Reviews.Author: josie013
Reviews.Content: Located in a residential area on the Asian side of Istanbul, Sumahan offers a perfect way of combining visits to the city from a wonderful setting alongside the Bosphorous. The large loft rooms overlook the water and downstairs open onto the small garden area in front of the suites from where you can see the minarets of Istanbul in the distance. The lovely hotel launch takes you across the Bosphorous to Besiktas( taking about 20 minutes) where trams, taxis, ferries and the underground are all waiting to take you on your way to the city. Breakfasts are good and the small hotel restaurant is open in the evening.There are 3 restaurants next door to the hotel, serving mainly fish, but the friendly and efficient staff have lots of good local recommendations. Travellng back to he hotel by launch from the city is only available until 7.30 pm, but ferries ply the water until late. The location may be a little way out of town for some, but the setting, and the thrill of crossing the water more than make up for what could be an inconvenience

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous getaway”
Reviews.Author: privacyplease2
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The Sumahan is a great way to experience the Bosphorus waterfront in a boutique hotel setting. If you're a first-timer to Istanbul, it may be a bit far from the action of Sultanahmet and the trendy shopping/dining districts of the European side. But if you prefer your base to be a relaxing escape from the bustle of the city, this is it. ROOMS: We stayed in a deluxe suite, which was an ideal configuration for two friends, as there were an extra closet and powder room. We loved being able to step out directly onto the riverfront lawn. (Only complaint: since our room was closest to the restaurant, we heard the clanging of dishes. However, I didn't request to change rooms.) SERVICE: The service was friendly and accommodating. Unless you speak Turkish, you will need the staff to help arrange your transportation, reservations, etc. One problem is the English of the night managers. In a hotel with international clientele and at these rates, you expect better. GENERAL: - Food at the Sumahan is good. For breakfast, the Turkish egg dish is excellent. I brought my own gluten-free bread and they toasted it for me in the mornings. - The restaurant two doors down, Rigal, has an excellent though limited menu. Staff there spoke only Turkish. - My favorite restaurant of the trip was Ulus 29-- the views, decor, menu/food, and service were superlative. - Traffic is Istanbul is nightmarish. If you can take a boat to cut travel time, whether the public ferry, scheduled hotel launch, or private sea-taxi, I highly recommend it. A pool would elevate the Sumahan to the next level! As it stands, it's a good, relaxed alternative to the behemoth Ciragan Palace and Four Seasons Bosphorus at a lower price point. We were so comfortable at the Sumahan, we went to breakfast in our pajamas.

Reviews.Title: “A truly idyllic spot on the bosphorus: Sumahan is a little paradise”
Reviews.Author: EleTbilisi
Reviews.Content: If you are after a place were you can rest in peace, if you wish to avoid the crowds of tourists rushing to all directions, but still want to be able to visit Istanbul and not to be too far away from the center, this is an ideal place for you. Sumahan is situated litterally on the Bosphorus: you will enjoy stunning views of the Bosphorus bridge, fisherman boats and ships cruising up and down, of the several marvallous mosques of Istanbul...all of this, just sitting in your room, or while having breakfast or dinner at the garden restaurant. I took a loft room at the garden level, and was able to sit in a deckchair reading a book and enyoing the cocktail and the strawberries kindly offered by the hotel. I have also tried the hammam and massage: the best I had in Istanbul! Another highlight is the little private launch that 'navigates' you from the hotel to Kabatas: simply wonderful! To conclude: the service is excellent, the rooms are beautiful and clean. The staff is very kind and professional, particularly Nural, who has the ability to make you feel like a star! I stronlgy recommend this hotel, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Pure bliss! A magical oasis in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Free-to-wander
Reviews.Content: Where do I start in describing this truly unique small hotel? It's the level of pampering service and attention to detail that made my stay here so outstanding. Its similarity to other European boutique hotels I had experienced in Portugal and Italy struck me, as it successfully blends a historical building with modern design. I found the overall look and feel of the Sumahan to be tasteful and warm. First of all, my stay here came at the end of a two-week trip to Turkey, ending in Istanbul. I thought that staying in Sultanhamet, near the monuments, would have been better. However, that area was very congested and noisy. Moving to the Sumahan was like taking a step into a magical oasis right in Istanbul. The boat transfer pick-up point at Kabatas, on Istanbul's European side, was extremely easy for the taxi driver to find. The captain of Sumahan's little boat helped me on board with a smile and off we went on a sunny April day, admiring the views of Istanbul's minarets and riverside palaces. Arriving at the hotel, I was greeted with a glass of fresh lemonade, a swift check-in, and a gracious escort to my room. My room didn't have a room number, but a name, Tarabya. It had a fireplace and large windows overlooking the Bosphorus; everything in the room was placed to maximize the great views. The marble bathroom was well appointed and I loved the handmade soaps. My last day in Istanbul was my day of rest. I was by then shopped and sight-seed out, so I made the most of the hotel's assets: the Bosphorus itself. I took the shuttle boat across to the nearest point, hopped a bus one stop to the quaint neighbourhood of Ortakoy (the hotel provided an Akbil bus pass); where I ate fried mussels, people watched while sipping a Turkish coffee, meandered a bit, window-shopped, then went back for the return shuttle boat. Going back into Sultanhamet would have been just as easy, with a taxi ride thrown in. That ease of getting to and from the hotel was a pleasant realization, as I hadn't been sure about that. Again, a glass of lemonade greeted my return. I finished the afternoon in the hotel's garden, sitting on an Adirondack chair facing the Bosphorus. Between watching the boats go by, observing the cormorants fish, and trying to read my book, I dozed off in the sun. When I woke, a wonderful young woman brought out an afternoon tea tray with sage tea and homemade cookies. I had mentioned earlier that I was hoping to enjoy this kind of tea again before I left Turkey and she remembered. I had booked an appointment for the hamam and went before dinner. It was blissful! The attendant was a lovely woman, who had magical hands. The products were very high quality, the massage skillful and I came out very relaxed, refreshed and glowing like a shiny new penny! It was the best way to prepare for the long flight home the next day. A final note about the food: Dinner, as well as the breakfasts, were very, very good, as well as the wine selection. The baklava was the best I have ever had - delicate and not syrupy sweet. The presentation was beautiful and the service excellent. Between the seafood restaurants next door and the hotel's own restaurant, I found that a quiet retreat to the hotel at night is a good way to end the day in Istanbul. My only regret was that my husband wasn't with me this time. I hope to go back to the Sumahan with him the next time I come to Turkey. I would recommend this wonderful hotel in a heartbeat... I couldn't help but think that for honeymooners or people taking a cruise, the Sumahan would be a very special treat!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot say enough about our fantastic experience at The Sumahan”
Reviews.Author: memlondon
Reviews.Content: Cannot imagine a better place to stay in Istanbul! Fantastic contemporary hotel with spectacular views from every position, situated along the Bosphorous Sea. Fabulous service from knowledgeable, incredible staff. The Sumahan has it's own boat that acts as a taxi across to central Istanbul, which is a wonderful way to get around. The Sumahan is a refuge from the hectic city atmosphere of Istanbul and is a wonderfully serene place to escape to after a long day soaking up the sights. It is also located in a neighbourhood with some of the best fish restaurants in Istanbul. Cannot say enough about our fantastic experience at The Sumahan!

Reviews.Title: “There's nowhere better in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BrendaTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Sumahan, formerly a distillery and now a luxury boutique hotel. Last year I came with a tv film crew and was super-impressed with the efficiency and professionalism of staff, the art-form presentation of a delicious Turkish breakfast, the excellent coffee and the lovely, spacious, contemporary rooms. This year, I have more to add to the list. Not only is my room gorgeous, complete with fireplace and comfortable seating facing the Bosphorus, but so was my sleep last night. The bed is very comfortable, as are the pillows. Linens are top notch too. Turkish breakfast was even better than I remembered it, with the addition of an egg dish and fresh strawberry crepes (in the UK they would call them pancakes, but in NA we call them crepes.) Today I treated myself to my first Turkish Bath in the hotel's hamam, and I can honestly say it was the best I have ever had! Also, the hamam was spotless. I wish I could eat in tonight as I know their manti is delicious, but I have another meeting. This is one hotel you will want to return to. This is the perfect place to unwind for a few days after touring and before returning home, or after staying in Sultanahmet, the old city. A drive up the Bosphorus from Cengilkoy on the Asian side provides one with a real sense of how the locals live and it's a beautiful drive too. One final note: the spoken English has dramatically improved since last year and the staff is the same, which says a lot for management. Also, I have noticed that they are very proactive and take care of details before they are asked or need to!

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed staying at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: WissahickonWanderer
Reviews.Content: I thought the Sumahan was great for several reasons. First, the location is stunning. Right on the shores of the Bosphorus, I was treated to a fantastic view 24 hours a day. I loved watching the sun glitter off the water, and the boats proceeding up the channel and the lights on the bridge at night. I really enjoyed Istanbul, but most of the tourist attractions are in a busy and congested part of the city. The Sumahan, located on the Asian side, provided a relaxing and quiet interval during the vacation which my teenage daughter and I had in Istanbul. Yet, we did not feel at all out of it. You can take an enjoyable one half hour ride in the hotel's boat to central Istanbul or you can take a taxi, and I found the fares to be cheap. I thought the atmosphere at the Sumahan was sophisticated, and the staff was excellent. The level of friendliness and responsiveness at Istanbul hotels is extemely high. In fact, I had never seen anything quite like it. But the Sumahan exceeded even this standard. The staff was incredibly friendly. The food was good too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: froggychap
Reviews.Content: Somewhat surprised at the 25 minutes water ride from the Europe side, which was in itself a great start to the vacation having sight of some of the sights from the water. From the moment we stepped ashore nothing was too much trouble, the manager on reception was as cheerful as could be explaining everything tp us. We had a super 2 level room.. The food in the restaurant was good, the seafood next door was brilliant. The girl serving us each night had the most welcoming smile I have ever seen. Everything worked, no one coomplaint - Loved it...

Reviews.Title: “Fab view - so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: macsym
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult one! Fabulous location, right by the Bosphorus, with stunning views. Wonderful to arrive (and depart) by the private and complimentary motor launch. Some staff friendly, others cool. Surprisingly our bedroom (on a non busy night) was probably one of the smallest. No fireplace, synthetic pillows and duvet, functional furniture. Some maintenance issues - desk lamp and bath waste not working. Compact room and small marble bathroom. Our 'package' should have included a bottle of wine and 15 minute massage - neither were forthcoming - although when we pushed we did receive the wine. However, the view from the (one) window was wonderful and it sort of compensated for the somewhat disappointing other aspects. The Kordon restaurant was fine - no more expensive than others and the fish was fresh and nicely cooked and presented and the service was satisfactory. There is also a very well stocked and interesting library where one could spend many enjoyable hours.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in Sumahan was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jleaf
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, there were loads of complimentary things, like nuts and fresh fruit, marzipan and they brought this olive flavoured oat crisps with the free wine. We had a loft suit with its own Turkish Bath and that was amazing as well except the fact that the shower bit was a bit cold but we didn't mind as we had the amazing Turkish Bath. The view was so great too. It was very peaceful and quiet. Breakfast was a good. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel”
Reviews.Author: malayar
Reviews.Content: one the best hotel ever thing was prefect room and service, location and i plan to stay there next time

Reviews.Title: “To stay at this hotel was a privilege. It was so very lovely in every way”
Reviews.Author: Lulu09Perth
Reviews.Content: I think needing some days to explore the wonders of Istanbul it was perfect to come across such a wonderful hotel. A retreat when arriving back to the Asian side by private ferry after busy adventures seeing the sites. The small towns within walking distance or local bus all having great restaurants. The hotel itself has a fantastic breakfast where you can sit and relax and plan your day with the water at your doorstep. The dinner menu is also excellent. To take time to enjoy the Spa is so very worthwhile. It is a sensational experience. All the staff are extremely helpful and kind and truly hope I have the opportunity to visit again soon. This was however my second stay at Sumahan in 2 years and it was very nice to be welcomed and recognised by staff. A wonderful experience in perfect surrounds with luxurious rooms with beautiful views of the Bospherous

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel to fall in love with”
Reviews.Author: LFCfan
Reviews.Content: The perfect place for a romantic break. Our first time in Istanbul and we were not disappointed. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel. It was spotlessly clean and well presented. The staff were very friendly and incredibly attentive, nothing was ever too much trouble. Infact they willingly went that extra mile for you every day. The food was delicious and presented well. The location of the hotel could not have been better, it seemed like we were miles away from the hustle and bustle of the city with a very serene atmosphere. Stunning views overlooking the Bosphorus and a fun boat ride to the other side when needed which was by far the best way to travel considering the amount of traffic in Istanbul. This hotel made our stay really wonderful and if we were ever to return I think we would definitely choose to stay at the Sumahan on the Water, I wouldn't want to be anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A totally charming hotel from which you can enjoy both the magic of the Bosphorus and the incredible sites of Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Relaxed_traveller_9
Reviews.Content: With so much to chose from on the internet I was so lucky to have found the Sumahan, the high scoring reviews are justified. I loved the fact my bedroom had floor to ceiling windows with views over the Bosphorus and that after breakfast I could jump into the hotels free boat service and be dropped off on the European side to walk around sites such as the Blue Mosque & Grand Bazaar. (you don't need to book a Bosphorus trip with this service!) Laden with bags and with tired legs I was grateful for the boat ride back to tranquility. There's a very popular fish restaurant next door where I watched several glamorous parties arrive by speed boat. Apparently in the summer months there is a rather chic floating swimming pool just by the opposite bank of the river which the hotel boat can drop you off at for a days lounging! I didn't try the hotels Hamman but a couple I spoke to said it was amazing. The staff totally made the stay - I have couldn't have felt more at home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for Relaxing and a great base to explore Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JeffersonLondon
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on the Asian shore of the Bosphorous just up from the Beylerbeyi Palace, this small hotel provides the perfect spot for a relaxing break. From the moment you arrive the staff discreetly look after your every need - with a chilled glass of lemonade as you stroll to your room after check in, being the first of many delights. The views from the suite we took were breath taking, and the rooms themselves were simply but very stylishly furnished. The bathroom was superb - as you would expect in Turkey. The hotel has an excellent bar / restaurant with a beautiful waterside terrace, a gym, its own hamam and a private launch which can take you across the Bosphorous at various times of the day. The library is very well chosen and in winter I can imagine strolling back to the fireplace in your room to enjoy the book of your choice. It is the staff however who are key to the success of this hotel and I couldn't fault them.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing experience from top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: Mll321
Reviews.Content: The sumahan made our trip to turkey completely unforgettable from the lovely and helpful staff to the breathtaking views and rooms. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the rooms plush and comfortable. The location is remote which was exactly what we were looking for for this leg of the trip--it was calm, quiet and peaceful. The whole stay was very special and truly could not have been more perfect. The private boat was an amazing experience which allowed us to essentiallly take a private tour of the bosphorous for no added cost. We give this hotel the highest recommendation. I hope we have the oportunity to stay at the sumahan again--and when we do we'll be sure to catch a fennerbache game!

Reviews.Title: “great location but expect a 2 star standard...”
Reviews.Author: oliviercale
Reviews.Content: Lured by the romantic setting & some of the buzz -incl. the Conde Nast Traveler rating, our experience from an amateur desk staff to appaling services (for starters, we had to pay the upgrade to get a room that was not in the stairwell, pathetic restaurant, meaningless complimentary boat shuttle runs only twice a day, 20 mn waiting for room service..etc) was rather disapointing...This is not across the water, it is a different continent & just a different notion of quality & professionalism. For anybody who has traveled the world in small or traditional luxury hotels, this doesn't warrant the buzz nor the overpriced rates that would get you amuch better location & a real world class hotel like the Ciragan Kempinski to which we switched too after 2 nights...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a romantic break”
Reviews.Author: fat_dave
Reviews.Content: In a tastefully converted distillery, Sumahan has genuine character. The keen eye of its architect owners is evident in the attention to detail and flawless execution of the renovation. Located on the Asian side, sightseeing is only a short boat ride away on either the hotels boat or public ferry. And on returning from the hustle and bustle of the city centre, Sumahan is a welcome tranquil oasis where we were could relax with an open log fire in our room. The views from the room were simply stunning, looking uninterrupted up and down the Bosporus. I loved the Hamam (Turkish bath) at the hotels spa. The staff were wonderfully helpful, knowledgeable and efficient. This was the best place I have ever stayed for a romantic getaway and I would definitely stay here again. The experience was simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: “The dream of the dreams”
Reviews.Author: BestTravellerWorld
Reviews.Content: Just few words to say how much is fantastic is this hotel. Great Hotel, great location and great Staff!! is like to be home. the best way to enjoy Istanbul ever.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect setting for romance”
Reviews.Author: FilipaP
Reviews.Content: Ancient distillary converted into a 5 star hotel with taste and know-how, Sumahan is a real oasis of calm .The interior is stylish and the rooms are clean,confortable and well-furnished. Since the hotel was built towards the Bosphorus, you can enjoy the breath-taking view everywhere from your room, from the breakfast room, even from the library !Situated in the Asian side ,approximately 30 minute distance from the cultural spots , you can choose between the hotel private boat or the regular ferry (5 minute walking from the hotel ) to do the crossing and the sightseeing begins...In addition the hotel is provided with all the facilities such as free internet, library, gym, Spa/turkish bath and restaurant .A word about the hotel staff ,the more efficient I've ever met whose help made this stay even more precious.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Hempeli
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling many times to Istanbul, but Sumahan Hotel ist the best hotel to stay - by far!! The rooms and its location are exceptional, the staff is very friendly and everybody tries to make your stay at Sumahan as special as possible. This is definitiely a place we recommend to everybody looking for something off the beaten track and individual. We can only recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathyinAthens
Reviews.Content: I have often consulted reviews here before embarking on a trip but never felt like submitting a review myself â€“ until now. My husband and I returned in mid-November from Istanbul, where we stayed 5 nights at this fantastic boutique hotel. I was so impressed that I decided I had to share with others our experience with this wonderful place. I must begin by saying that I disagree totally with a recent negative review. This hotel has it all: Great service. The staff was unfailingly pleasant and helpful. Great location. It is on the Asian side of the Bosporus and, as its full name implies, it is right â€œon the water.â€� After a full day of sightseeing in the old city, we enjoyed climbing aboard the ferryboat, ordering a glass of tea and sailing off to the pleasant little community of Cengolkoy. Sumahan is only a 5-minute stroll from where the boat docks. Back in our room, we could sit out on the lawn chairs, relaxing in peace and quiet as we watched night fall and the bridge and skyline of the old city light up across the water â€“ an unforgettable view. Great food. Breakfast is a feast for the eyes as well as the tummy. A big basket of fresh bread rolls and a beautifully presented tray of little bowls with the (unusual for us) colorful combination of fresh veggies, olives -- and sweet things like comb honey and tasty jams (made in-house, we were told!). We ate one night in the restaurant in the hotel â€“ generous portions perfectly seasoned. A second night we ate at the conveniently-located 5-star Kordon next door, a gastronomical experience worthy of a separate review. Great architectural design. We appreciated the sophisticated taste that informed both the public spaces and the individual rooms. The interior design is breathtakingly lovely, modern but with echoes of tradition: marble bathrooms and fluted ceilings, for example. You could see that love and care went into every detail. Each day a tray of ripe unblemished fruit (purple plums, pale green pears) was left in our room after it was tidied â€“ a perfect symbol of the hotelâ€™s attention to providing guests with a truly perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “If perfect had a name, it would be Sumahan”
Reviews.Author: WestPhillyTravels
Reviews.Content: I have been to my fair share of hotels, but I was completely unprepared for the joy of Sumahan. The room was exceptionally well appointed and the details were meticulous down to the delicious chocolates welcoming me. The staff was so helpful that I was taken off guard and the food was exquisite (I recommend the Manti - Turkish Raviolli). In the evening we were treated to a beautiful fire in the room and the glow of Istanbul dancing across the Bosphorous. However, the gift that set Sumahan apart was the Turkish bath (Hamam), which left me so relaxed that I could have spent hours sipping the cool tea offered as I reclined in the spa. Not having a Turkish bath is a loss, but not having one at Sumahan is a crime. I didn't use it, but the hotel has a boat that will shuttle you to points along the strait. All of the calm of a seaside getaway in the middle of one of the biggest and most exciting cities on Earth. Exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ballner
Reviews.Content: I can recommend Sumahan to everybody, who is looking for a relaxing stay in "hectic" Istanbul. It`s just a ten minute ride out of the center by taxi, but has a very quiet and unique position at the shores of Bosphorus. Also, the complimentary boat transfer in the morning is a great idea. Not to forget the new Spa - I had an excellent massage there. General service and quality of my room was NÂ° 1 as well. All in all, I had a great stay there and want to say "Thank you" to everybody at this unique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but too far away”
Reviews.Author: JumboDuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sumahan for 2 nights in Aug 08. It is a very beautiful hotel, with stunning views of the Bosphorus and the private boat service that ferrys the hotel's guest from the hotel and downtown is indeed a very stylish touch - however it is just too far away! The boat service is very good and efficient when it runs (30 mins between hotel and downtown). However the last service ends before dinner time - and if one misses the hotel boat its either an expensive taxi trip back (most likely with traffic jams along the way) or it will involve a ferry ride + taxi connection. Anyhow - overall a very enjoyable experience particularly if you are looking for a designer hotel!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: manliovalerio
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a beautiful location, excellent structures and service. Being on the eastern side of the Bosphur is very pleasant, at the end of the day, to leave the noise of the old town and to sail back (by the hotel's boat). The management is extremly friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely ....but not 100%”
Reviews.Author: Amelle
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Istanbul. And we were pleasantly suprised. Much more sophisticated than expected. The hotel was good... very boutique where things look good but are not every time practical. We booked a family room ( duplex) and we spent all our time telling our 3 year old daughter not to use the stairs... leathal for a child. The room servicce was very good and quick. BUT do not try the Kodron restaurant.. very stuffy ( unless you like having 5 waiters watching you eat at the end of your table!). The staff barely understood English and they serve very spicy food to our child. And she loves arabic food!!! AND the prices are way too expensive .... we ate at the Four seasons an excellent meal at half the price. Bad experience all the way that left a big hole in our pocket. The hotel staff was pleasant. Just right. As for going to Istanbul, do use the public boat ( 5-10 min from the hotel) with a much more flexible timetable ( at the boat only leaved once in the morning and come back once in the afternoon). All in all , good hotel with fantastic view. Not top level quality, but good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: whethergirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sumahan for the first week of our fabulous two-week Turkish honeymoon. It was a wonderful choice, and after months of research of properties in Istanbul, I'm so glad we chose the Sumahan. A word of caution - make sure you realize, when booking this hotel, that it is not centrally located to all the sightseeing attractions in Istanbul. If you prefer to be in the "center of the action", stay in Sultanahmet. If you're looking for a quiet retreat at the end of a busy day, the Sumahan is an excellent choice.
